snippet.textDisplay:
With all those false predictions on peak oil, along with the numerous failed predictions on apocalyptic climate change, do you think it makes any sense to radically alter our lives for an event that is so unpredictable?


I think the best course of action is to let the free-market and its innovations take their course. There will come a time when renewables are naturally more efficient than fossil fuels, or CCS technologies have matured enough to reduce externalities.
snippet.textOriginal:
With all those false predictions on peak oil, along with the numerous failed predictions on apocalyptic climate change, do you think it makes any sense to radically alter our lives for an event that is so unpredictable?


I think the best course of action is to let the free-market and its innovations take their course. There will come a time when renewables are naturally more efficient than fossil fuels, or CCS technologies have matured enough to reduce externalities.

snippet.textDisplay: Something to keep in mind: We are currently still dependent on oil and coal to meet global energy demands. As stated at the beginning of this video, Google is investing heavily into renewables, as well as the AI to consume said renewable energy as efficiently as possible. Oil as a fuel source will be a thing of the past... in the future. But right now the world would be thrown into a massive upheaval if not for fossil fuel. The world in the midst of a transition in terms of energy consumption. Transitions take time. Again, just something to keep in mind.
snippet.textOriginal: Something to keep in mind: We are currently still dependent on oil and coal to meet global energy demands. As stated at the beginning of this video, Google is investing heavily into renewables, as well as the AI to consume said renewable energy as efficiently as possible. Oil as a fuel source will be a thing of the past... in the future. But right now the world would be thrown into a massive upheaval if not for fossil fuel. The world in the midst of a transition in terms of energy consumption. Transitions take time. Again, just something to keep in mind.
